parts.text: Yoo  talk to my boy Jack, he takes smokes alot
Jack my gee! Wetin dey happen? Dem don tell me say you dey puff puff like chimney o! 😂 No finish all the *igbo* for market abeg, make you dey take am easy small small. Na only one life we get! 😉
Jack, fam, what's good? Heard you been spending *way* too much time in the goon cave. My man, give your wrist a break! 😂 Fr tho, pace yourself!

Avogadro's Law states that **equal volumes of all gases, at the same temperature and pressure, contain the same number of molecules (or moles)**.

In simpler terms, for a given mass of an ideal gas, the volume and the number of moles are directly proportional if the temperature and pressure are kept constant. Mathematically, this can be expressed as:

V ∝ n (at constant T and P)

where V is the volume, and n is the number of moles.

This law implies that the molar volume of any ideal gas at Standard Temperature and Pressure (STP, 0°C and 1 atm) is approximately 22.4 liters.
